snippet: The state will hire a monitor and a research expert to oversee the New York City system, which a lawsuit claimed irreparably harmed children who went too long without permanent families.
abstract: New York State settles federal class-action lawsuit that alleged children in New York City's foster care system are suffering irreparable harm due to how long they go without permanent families; settlement requires state to enlist monitor and research expert as watchdogs over city's system.
